intro: Diplopterygium simulans, commonly known as the false holly, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, simple, and usually elliptic leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense, umbel-like inflorescences. The fruit is a two-lobed capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds.
